headline.print_headline: Trend Persists of Prisons as Mental Health Housing
headline.main: Trend Persists of Prisons as Mental Health Housing

lead_paragraph: A federal judge's objection to what he called the horrific treatment of some mentally ill inmates in California prisons highlights a trend that has been building for decades in the state and across the country: As mental hospitals closed or were scaled back, prisons and county jails have become the de facto housing for many who are mentally ill.
